list_definition.definition: to look at, or view, in a general way

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He surveyed his neat garden with satisfaction.

list_definition.definition: to examine carefully or in detail
to measure, and estimate the position, shape etc of (a piece of land etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They have started to survey the piece of land that the new motorway will pass through.

list_definition.definition: to make a formal or official inspection of (a house etc that is being offered for sale).
a look or examination; a report

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: After a brief survey of the damage he telephoned the police
He has written a survey of crime in big cities.

list_definition.definition: a careful measurement of land etc.
